channel.title: Comments on: Website Redesign: Getting a Handle on Our Information Architecture

item.title: By: 2020 Website Usability Testing – Off the Shelf
item.dc:creator: 2020 Website Usability Testing – Off the Shelf
item.description: […] of what users needed were right, and in others they were wrong. As was written in the summary for the 2016 testing, “This is why we test: logical assumptions don’t always line up with user […]

item.title: By: Tab McDaniel
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/07/07/website-redesign-getting-a-handle-on-our-information-architecture/#comment-581">Jonathan Johnson</a>.
Thnx! Ping me if you want to talk about testing methods ...
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jonathan Johnson.

Thnx! Ping me if you want to talk about testing methods …

item.title: By: Jonathan Johnson
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Johnson
item.description: I love this low impact way of testing assumptions. I'm trying to figure out how we can steal it. Great write up.
item.content:encoded: I love this low impact way of testing assumptions. I’m trying to figure out how we can steal it. Great write up.

item.title: By: Ariel Deardorff
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description: Haha yep! Although all thanks goes to Kemi for gathering those images.
item.content:encoded: Haha yep! Although all thanks goes to Kemi for gathering those images.

item.title: By: Tab McDaniel
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/07/07/website-redesign-getting-a-handle-on-our-information-architecture/#comment-574">Ariel Deardorff</a>.
Thanks! Also, thanks for the super-mathy chalkboard image from one of your presentations ... I think it was the LibQUAL results overview?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ariel Deardorff.

Thanks! Also, thanks for the super-mathy chalkboard image from one of your presentations … I think it was the LibQUAL results overview?
